contentrichtext.text: [[Image:NZ-Oreti R.png|thumb|right|160px|The Oreti River system]] The '''Oreti River''' is one of the main rivers of [[Southland, New Zealand]], and is 170 kilometres in length. The river has been identified as an [[Important Bird Area]] by [[BirdLife International]] because, for much of its length, it supports [[bird colony|breeding colonies]] of [[Black-billed Gull]]s.<ref name=bli>{{cite web |url= http://www.birdlife.org |title= Oreti River |accessdate=2012-11-13 |work= BirdLife data zone: Important Bird Areas |first= |last= |publisher= BirdLife International |date= 2012}}</ref> The Oreti has its headwaters close to the [[Mavora Lakes]] between [[Lake Te Anau]] and [[Lake Wakatipu]], and flows south across the [[Southland Plains]] to its outflow into [[Foveaux Strait]] at the southeastern end of [[Oreti Beach]]. En route, it runs through the towns of [[Lumsden, New Zealand|Lumsden]] and [[Winton, New Zealand|Winton]], before passing through the city of [[Invercargill]], close to the river's [[estuary]]. For the final part of the river's length, around the city of Invercargill and the river's estuary just south of the city, it is known as the '''New River''', a name occasionally encountered to refer to the whole river. <!-- Possible water conservation order http://www.beehive.govt.nz/ViewDocument.aspx?DocumentID=27044 --> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Oreti}} {{coord|46|28|S|168|17|E|display=title|region:NZ_type:river_source:GNS-enwiki}} [[Category:Rivers of the Southland Region]] [[Category:Important Bird Areas of New Zealand]] {{Southland-geo-stub}}
